title: nitrobetting
author: nitrobetting
content: 1.Bet half your usual unitSpreads lines in football and basketball don’t really have many longshots. The spread is there to even the wager. So if a football teams is -6, the idea is the favored team should win by at least 6.However, when it comes to longshot money line plays, there are pitfalls. We have to be selective.Selective often means we lower our bet. Cutting our bet unit in half on longshot money line plays helps us manage risk. Most ML longshots lose. So we must pick our spots and then be careful with our investments.2. Handicap the line for valueJust like we do when betting against the spread, we must look for value when we handicap money line longshots. Value can come in the form of a false favorite, an underdog having an edge at home, or simple handicapping intuition.One of the best places to find value is against undefeated NFL teams on the road against a squad they’re supposed to beat. Often, the NFL chalk will bounce a week after a signature victory.Longshot opportunities abound with this angle.3. If the public likes your longshot bet, stay awayThe public loves to bet favorites. So when the public jumps on a longshot, we should consider it a negative.Anytime we agree with the public, we must study why. We are professional handicappers. Or if we’re not pros, we at least have more knowledge than most casual sports bettors. So we have to think hard if the public agrees with us. This goes for ML and ATS longshot plays.Keep reading→ https://n2g.io/8209494

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: I agree with the first point, even though half a unit is still a lot for some gamblers because it depends on how much you divide your bankroll. Going smaller is recommended as long as the minimum bet limit allows it.The second point is difficult for a bettor like me who always prefers to go with the favorites. My alternative is going for teasers since I sometimes see other bettors recommend a few good underdog spreads worth taking and consistently covering when you put them under a teaser. If teasers aren't available, i'd look for the alt spread and parlay from there because there are times when the odds are better with parlays.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Exactly. Many bettors treat longshot bets as they would treat regular types of betting as if these don't come with a lot more caveats in a sense. For instance, you're already at a disadvantage betting for a team that's statistically determined to lose that particular match. The pay is good but only if you're really lucky and if you know what to do to minimize losses in the process. Reads like these are so important in opening the people's eyes to what and how sportbetting really work cause a lot of these people think it's just placing your trust on a team you want to win and then hoping for the best when there are more stuff that's going on with it than what you can afford to even understand.
